column4: Bodsa: So, what is your CPU doing: low-priority tasks, kernel, running some particular processes?
whatever app is using the wifi is spiking 90%-100% cpu
firefox and xorg cause cpu spikes
im not exactly sure what you want?
it turns RED -- and no ping doesnt cause lag, but its an extremely tiny packet its sending
however if i increase the ping packet size to 50000 it lags
yes telnet causes a small amount of lag
no, i just wanted to increase packet size to see if ping could cause lag
should i close all internet using apps (inlcuding xchat) then try with something heavy like youtube?
ok, cya in a sec, cheers dude
was that command   ever meant to finish by itself?
it scrolled off the screen so i dont have the top part, -- il get the 'while internet heavy' dump now
heres the wifi heavy dump -- http://paste.ubuntu.com/24218/
i notice alot of packets dropped by server, is this relevant?
what should i be looking for in those dumps?
cheers dude, but i dunno what to investigate
